def: Having all the parts of the same kind alike in size and shape;as, a regular flower; a regular sea urchin.
Quickly; rapidly; -- a direction for a quick, lively movementor performance; quicker than allegro, or any rate of time exceptprestissimo.
Down the stream; as, floating downstream.
Of, pertaining to, or of the nature of, colic. Swift.
To regard in a sentimental manner; as, to sentimentalize asubject.
To ret, or rot, in water, as flax; to water-rot.
Having or producing scurf; covered with scurf; resemblingscurf.
To speak or write with exaggeration. Bp. Montagu.
fr. Smooth, v. Smoothing iron, an iron instrument with apolished face, for smoothing clothes; a sadiron; a flatiron.-- Smoothing plane, a short, finely set plane, for smoothing andfinishing work.
